Articles.Content: I know we all want to ask, but fear of ban because bumps, so I'll go ahead and ask. What have you been up to as of lately, and when do you think (even if it's a rough estimate) we'll get some previews of the next version? :D
That's incredible. I just hope someday we get this in stock and will be able to throw stuff around and watch them spin and float in zero G.

[quote name='nikokespprfan']I tried to do this, just to see how hard it'd be. It certainly causes some limitations while designing. But along the way I got the following situation:  

[url]https://docs.google.com/document/d/10P7jx3FySCUxW3tne66Xqvy6tbjs8qmyvUASnMbH2Yc/edit?usp=sharing[/url]  

What you see here are Hitchhikers that are attached by radial attachment points, but because I have offset the hitchhikers, they wouldn't be accessible though them. In the middle you see structural fuselage parts, with the outside hatch of the hitchhikers facing into the structural fuselage.  

I know this was not your intention, but I want to ask if for this part, you could make it so that a crew-able part cuts a hole in this IVA, even if it's not aligned properly or attached radially.[/QUOTE]  

That's an interesting suggestion. Allowing attachment to external hatches like a vacuum-capable [url=http://kkcdn-static.kaskus.co.id/images/2013/02/11/1422659\_20130211075719.jpg]airbridge[/url] would provide lots of interesting building opportunities. Having parts specifically designed for procedual IVAs, like your hub that the hitchhikers are attached around, would be an interesting concept to play around with. You're not cutting holes through equipment, you're designing a tunnel specifically for a craft, with IVA hatches automatically being placed inside when you attach parts outside. It's a great idea and I'd like to see what I can do with it in future.  

[quote name='ronnie4444']I know we all want to ask, but fear of ban because bumps, so I'll go ahead and ask. What have you been up to as of lately, and when do you think (even if it's a rough estimate) we'll get some previews of the next version? :D[/QUOTE]  

It's been nearly a month since the last status report, so I think you're safe to ask :) Life has been extremely busy for the past month, and next month will likely be even more busy. The only KSP development I've managed was to update [url=http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101496-1-0-x-Collision-FX-v3-2-%282015-11-04%29-Now-with-biome-coloured-dust!]Collision FX[/url], [url=http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/122158-1-0-5-Water-Sounds-v1-1-%282015-11-17%29]Water Sounds[/url] and [url=http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55104-1-0-x-Rover-Wheel-Sounds-v1-3-%282015-11-10%29]Rover Wheel Sounds[/url], which had been broken by the 1.0.5 release. On the plus side, 1.0.5 was a great release for Free IVA. If you've tried out Free IVA with 1.0.5, you'll see that the new cockpit IVAs have been made traversable by crew with properly aligned doors, hatches and lots of fancy internals. Porkjet has been very busy :)
